jobs.title: Cost Estimator
jobs.description:
Who We Are: Infinite Consulting Corp. is a project, program, and construction management firm established in 2009 specializing in safety management, quality management, project and construction management, and project controls. We proudly provide the highest level of service and support at each phase of our clients' projects. Our client's success is our success.

We put people first and we've... created a culture that attracts professional, passionate, and caring individuals who are actively working together to solve problems. As a team member with Infinite, you’re visible. You are heard. You can expect to make a difference through your work and to have a direct impact on achieving our mission: to safely build tomorrow. Ready to join our team? We offer a generous benefits package for eligible employees, and lots of room for career growth.

Role & Responsibilities:

The Cost Estimator is a key player in the Estimator department, supporting estimating needs both internally and for the Company’s clients. They will help prepare estimates for various construction projects in the New York City area. The estimator is an entry-level position that will work closely with the Senior Estimators within the department who specialize in different sectors of the estimating space.
• Prepare and review cost estimates for various aspects of construction project including but not limited to mechanical, electrical, civil, or plumbing
• Interact with clients to understand requirements and deliver upon their estimating needs
• Support the estimating tasks throughout the construction phase of a project including change orders and the tracking of estimated cos vs actual spend
• Collect, review and analyze various documents to help support overall estimating needs
• Study data around unit rates and commodity pricing to inform estimating processes
• Work as a collaborative member of the overall team, working on side projects as needed, and partnering with other areas of the business
• Support the maintenance of historical estimating documents, including the organization and reference of said documents when relevant

Skills, Education, and Experience Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in engineering is highly preferred, will consider relevant degrees or equivalent work experience
• Technically savvy, able to work efficiently in a remote environment utilizing Teams, Outlook and other relevant systems to collaborate with teammates throughout the day
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• High attention to detail, especially when it comes to working with numbers
• Exceptional quantitative skills displayed in previous coursework or work experience
• Knowledge of or previous experience working with NYC agencies a plus
Benefits provided but not limited to the following:
• Medical
• Dental
• Vision
• 401k with 4% match
• Short Term and Long-Term Disability
• Life Insurance
• Paid Time Off (PTO & Sick Time)
• Company Holidays
• Great company culture that genuinely cares!
• Autonomy in your role

Sounds like you? APPLY TODAY

Philanthropy Opportunities
The Infinite Cares mission is to donate our time, money, and energy to causes that make the world a better place. We encourage everybody to find causes they are passionate about and look for ways to make a difference. Take a look and see how we are giving back www.infinitecares.co

New York City Equal Pay Disclaimer Infinite Consulting Corp carefully considers multiple factors to determine compensation, including a candidate’s experience, education, and training. The estimated salary for this position is $65,000 - $80,000 annually.

Equal Opportunity Disclaimer We are an equal opportunity employer and referral source. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines

jobs.title: Financial Sales Consultant
jobs.description:
about WSC:

Wall Street Consulting specializes in providing financial solutions to support our clients' business plans and optimize their growth potential. As a member of our firm, you will play a crucial role in delivering personalized guidance and tailored financial strategies to our customers, fostering strong relationships in a face-to-face setting...

Job Description:

Build and expand a client base by acquiring new clients on an ongoing basis. Offer knowledgeable and customized financial guidance to meet clients' specific needs. Maintain regular contact with clients to stay informed about any changes in their financial status. Sell a range of financial products and services, including investments, business loans, mortgages, and more. While finance experience is not necessary, a keen interest in sales and a drive to succeed are essential. As an advisor at Wall Street Consulting, you will have the opportunity to build your own book of business with support from our comprehensive training programs. This typically involves a strong focus on sales initially, requiring a sales-oriented and entrepreneurial mindset.

Skills: Excellent communication skills to effectively interact with clients. Interest in sales, marketing, and entrepreneurship. Results-driven, highly motivated, and proactive self-starter.

Benefits: Optional Practical Training (OPT) and Curricular Practical Training (CPT) available. Possibility of H1-B visa sponsorship based on work performance.

Experience: Preferably 1 year of relevant experience and 1 year in the finance industry.

Language: Proficiency in English and Mandarin/Cantonese required.

Job Type: Full-time

Responsibilities:

Generate new business using consultative sales approach.

Call qualified leads, schedule follow-ups and close the deal. no experience required

Follow up on all leads and maintain a very active pipeline daily.

Interview prospective clients to obtain data about their financial

Self-motivated, entrepreneurial, proactive & results driven

Prepare documentation and provide solutions to clients.

Good business acumen, with the ability to understand a prospect's business model in a variety of industries

Serve as an enthusiast for company's product options.

Good organization and multi-tasking skills

Strong interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills with the ability to develop strong relationships both internally and with clients

Literally change the landscape of small business financing one conversation at a time!

Bring your thinking, strategies, and ideas to advance our company's values, unique culture, and vision for the future.

Ability to work with a limited amount of supervision.

Have a meaningful impact on the company's future.

Who We Look For:

A proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets, and keeping a pipeline full of qualified prospects Excellent customer relations skills and sales and referral skills An outgoing positive person who enjoys building relationships Professional and enthusiastic presentation Highly motivated, results-driven, self-starter who possesses integrity, a strong work ethic. Strong organizational skills that reflect the ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly with excellent attention to detail. Think big. Need to have a desire to make a lot of money by getting bigger deals, cross-sells and up-sells. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships and trust quickly over the phone. Very strong verbal communication skills. Valid driver's license, insurance, and reliable vehicle Demonstrated proactive approaches to problem-solving in order to close the business. Highly resourceful team member with the ability to be extremely effective both independently and as part of a sales team. Demonstrated ability to achieve high performance goals and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision. Proven successful skills in sales and service in a retail sales environment. Previous banking experiences a plus.

Must be computer literate with working knowledge of Word, Excel and Windows software, and the ability to efficiently operate standard office equipment, including a computer, printer, fax and calculator

jobs.title: Internal Consulting Group Manager, SVP - Hybrid
jobs.via: via Jobs And Careers At Citi
jobs.description:
Internal Consulting Group Manager, SVP - Hybrid

The Internal Consulting Solutions (ICS) organization is a dynamic and expanding team within Citi responsible for leading high value initiatives to meet Citi’s transformation and business priorities. The ICS organization delivers significant programs in close partnership with Citi’s functional and business unit senior leadership. ICS covers a... diverse set of critical initiatives which vary in size, duration, and complexity sponsored by senior leadership which have significant and measurable business value outcomes.

The ICS team is an interdisciplinary team comprised of colleagues with deep management consulting and financial services expertise engaging Citi employees at all stakeholder levels.
• The SVP is part of the core member of Citi’s internal consulting (IC) organization. The key roles of the internal consulting organization are to lead significant programs in partnership with Citi’s functional and business unit leadership; to develop Citi’s approaches and methods; to build change capabilities across Citi; and to engage Citi employees at all levels in transformational change.
• The SVP uses methodologies to deliver and support specific Citi operating model and business process improvement projects and programs. Projects will vary in size, duration, and complexity; will have measurable business value outcomes; and will have senior management to Executive-level sponsorship.
• In addition to participating on operating model, process improvement and process transformation projects and programs, the SVP owns specific workstreams to ensure delivery against project objectives, provides support as a thought leader in methodologies relative to process analysis, design, and implementation approaches and methods to be leveraged on projects undertaken by the internal consulting organization. As such, the individual is expected to support IC Senior Leadership in building the internal consulting team’s approach for delivery of operating model, process improvement and process transformation.
• The performance of the SVP will be measured by a combination of individual and team metrics including value return on process improvement and transformation projects and programs, stakeholder feedback, and contribution to thought and team leadership.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Support IC Leadership to scope and launch operating model, process improvement and process transformation projects, applying agile principles, by identifying business needs, validating key pain points, and determining the business case for change. Use hypotheses development, data analysis / analytics, and process mapping tools and methods to establish project scope and potential value. Conduct and incorporate research and competitive analysis as required.
• Support IC Leadership to devise innovative solutions through leveraging an agile methodology to address process pain points and value opportunities. Participate in planning and conducting functional and cross-functional working sessions to develop future state process models that address value opportunities. Support conducting and incorporating leading practice assessments and benchmarking as required.
• Participate in leveraging change management approaches and methods and support the assessment of organization capacity and readiness for change. Use the assessment to work with business leaders to establish an implementation plan for process improvement / process transformation that identifies timing, key projects / initiatives, resources / teams, and change management approach.
• Own the development of project plans, including backlogs and user stories, establishment of Steering Team(s), and mobilization and launch of project teams to support operating model, process improvement and process transformation project launch.
• Leverage Six Sigma, Lean, DMAIC, and other common process change methodologies and support the establishment of the Citi Productivity Playbook for Process Improvement and Process Transformation.
• Help create culture change within Citi. Reduce time to market, boost quality, raise employee morale and become a more adaptive organization.
• Must be eligible to work in US. This position does not offer VISA sponsorship.

QUALIFICATIONS:
• At least 10+ years of experience in Operating Model, Process improvement and Process Transformation projects for end-to-end processes crossing business areas / siloes within Financial Services, Consulting (strong preference for management consulting experience) or Investment Banking. 3+ years serving as a project / program manager on operating model, process reengineering or transformation projects, using agile methodologies, that delivered demonstrated ROI and which were sponsored by Senior management. Some experience within Banking and Financial Services or another regulated industry is strongly preferred. Management Consulting experience is required.
• Proven capability to support the development / adaption of Process improvement and Process Transformation approaches and methods, and support others on the approaches and methods, as necessary. Experience with Lean and Six Sigma, DMAIC, or other process change methodologies required.
• Familiarity with digitalization concepts and emerging trends as it relates to Process Improvement and Process Transformation and experience integrating technology priorities and requirements into the development of holistic process models and solutions.
• Strong written and verbal communications skills
• Demonstrated experience creating, owning, and developing PowerPoint presentations and similar forms of communication
• Advanced skills in MS Excel, PowerPoint and other data visualization tools
• Experience analyzing processes and creating process maps / user journeys

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS:
• Required Competencies:
• Agile Delivery (preferred)
• Process Mapping and Analysis (six sigma or comparable)
• Process Design Support
• Support Operational KPI Development, Measurement, and Analysis
• Root Cause Analysis
• Support Business Case Development and Tracking
• Functional and Business Knowledge (some of the below):
• Consumer and Institutional Banking
• Risk Management
• Compliance
• Finance
• Human Resources
• Operations
• Technology

CHARACTERISTICS:
• Strong ability to identify issues, structure and conduct analyses, organize findings, draw conclusions, identify next steps, and make recommendations with limited guidance
• Can work effectively in a team-based collaborative model as well as independently
• Thinks business first but quickly grasps and can be conversant in digital technologies and their application to business processes
• Innovative and curious, and readily able to think outside of the box
• Communicates effectively and impactfully to all levels of an organization, from line workers to Senior Leaders; proficient to expert use of PowerPoint presentation for story-telling relative to the business case for change, the results of analysis, and the plan forward
• Self-starter who brings high sense of urgency to assignments and goals
• Comfortable with ambiguity and change
• Passionate about improving employee and customer experience
• Has strong project management skills but deploys a flexible approach to meet the needs of a broad group of diverse stakeholders
• Balances analytical and creative abilities
• Detail oriented and effective multi-tasker

EDUCATION:
• Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred.

This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

Our commitment to diversity includes a workforce that represents the clients we serve globally from all walks of life, backgrounds, and origins. We foster an environment where the best people want to work. We value and demand respect for others, promote individuals based on merit, and ensure opportunities for personal development are widely available to all. Ideal candidates are innovators with well-rounded backgrounds who bring their authentic selves to work and complement our culture of delivering results with pride. If you are a problem solver who seeks passion in your work, come join us. We’ll enable growth and progress together.

About Citi

Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments, and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com | Twitter: @Citi | YouTube: www.youtube.com/citi | Blog: http://blog.citigroup.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/citi | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/citi.

jobs.title: Actimize Consultant
jobs.description:
Our client, an International Bank, is seeking an Actimize Developer to join their team. Please review the details below and apply if you would be interested.

Actimize Developer...

12 months plus contract role

Hybrid - 1 day per week in Jersey City, NJ

The Actimize Applications Systems Specialist supports the compliance applications, systems and services that ensure the bank meets all of its legal and regulatory responsibilities and obligations in connection with Anti-Money Laundering (AML)- Specifically SAM v.10

This role is fully knowledgeable on the functionality of Actimize software and collaborates with Business and Support groups on Enhancements, System upgrades and on-call user support.The Specialist’s job is primarily transaction focused with a strong tactical core that requires, exercising discretion and independent judgment to resolve challenges and achieve the business teams’ goals.

Responsibilities
• Plan, design, develop/implement code/configuration for AML SAM 10
• Perform analysis to determine and verify business requirements/issues specification, flows and deliverables for projects.
• Research and evaluate alternative solutions and make/implement recommendations.
• Prepare essential documentation to define requirements, test plan and analysis.
• Perform support for Compliance applications; Troubleshoot issues in all the environments and perform root cause analysis.
• Maintain high customer satisfaction through the delivery of high quality, timely, SLA and solutions to problems.
• Communicate effectively and pro-actively with business users, support teams, vendor, and all stakeholders.
• Multi-task and work on multiple projects with varying priorities and deadlines.
• Create and execute test cases and scripts for testing of changes and releases.
• Upgrade system software working in conjunction with users.
• Perform system debugging tasks.
• Investigate system issues with the application and other system components.
• Provide on call support on a rotating basis.
• Document and maintain functional requirements and process system flows.

Qualification
• Proven hands-on experience with Actimize - AML SAM v.10 (moving from version 8)
• At least 7 or more years’ experience in implementing technologies and/or vendor platforms to service the business need and/or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline.
• Demonstrated experience with IT development, system design & integration and data analysis.
• Ability to independently manage, organize and prioritize multiple tasks, projects and responsibilities.
• Ensure functionality of product meets with business requirements and expectations.
• Well-developed research and analytical skills with good problem solving and lateral thinking ability.
• Analysis of existing applications to identify weakness and develop opportunities for improvements.
• Team-oriented, must be self-motivated, plan and manage time effectively, and be customer focused.
• Flexible and adaptable to new environments. Ability to quickly learn new systems, products and businesses; Proactive and result-oriented.
• Experience in UNIX and Windows shell scripting for process automation.
• Experience with SQL scripting (Oracle, MS SQL).
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to articulate concepts and ideas to diverse audiences.
• Detailed, thorough, diligent individual with robust data analysis, customer service and time management skills.
• Experience in waterfall and agile development.
• Excellent oral and written communication skills.
• Strong knowledge and experience with AML, Fraud, Trade Surveillance and other compliance functions.
• Requires extensive knowledge and experience in all facets of software development, IT operations, decision-making, strong judgment, management skills and a considerable aptitude in human relations.
• Prior experience in Banking / Financial industry would be preferred.

If this is a role that interests you and you’d like to learn more, click apply now and a recruiter will be in touch with you to discuss this great opportunity. We look forward to speaking with you!

About ManpowerGroup, Parent Company of:Manpower, Experis, Talent Solutions, and Jefferson Wells

ManpowerGroup® (NYSE: MAN), the leading global workforce solutions company, helps organizations transform in a fast-changing world of work by sourcing, assessing, developing, and managing the talent that enables them to win. We develop innovative solutions for hundreds of thousands of organizations every year, providing them with skilled talent while finding meaningful, sustainable employment for millions of people across a wide range of industries and skills. Our expert family of brands – Manpower, Experis, Talent Solutions, and Jefferson Wells – creates substantial value for candidates and clients across more than 75 countries and territories and has done so for over 70 years. We are recognized consistently for our diversity - as a best place to work for Women, Inclusion, Equality and Disability and in 2022 ManpowerGroup was named one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the 13th year - all confirming our position as the brand of choice for in-demand talent

jobs.title: Seabury Management Consulting Senior Manager
jobs.description:
Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.

People in our Client & Market career track drive... profitable growth by developing market-relevant insights to increase market share or to create new markets. They progress through required promotion points in market-facing roles that have a direct impact on sales and revenue.

Acquired by Accenture in 2017, Seabury Consulting provides a unique combination of consulting, restructuring, transformation, commercial planning and software solutions to all segments of the aviation and travel industry.

Seabury Consulting’s Human Capital consulting team is the most sought-after executive compensation and labor solutions provider for airlines and also acts as the primary human capital consultancy for multiple global private equity firms. We have a track record of managing dozens of highly successful projects in the past three years managing organization transformations including restructurings, post-merger integrations, labor negotiations, project management office (PMO) and change management support.

The Human Capital team of Seabury Consulting now part of Accenture is a boutique advisory group which assists clients in aviation and other travel-related industries to optimize their human capital related activities such as workforce planning and analytics, organizational design and effectiveness, compensation plan design, labor relations, and talent search. Given our roots in aviation and travel-related industries, it is common for our engagements to take us to our Fortune 500 clients’ sites around the globe.

As a Senior Manager, you will lead a team of highly motivated Consultants in the sourcing, planning and execution of engagements ensuring timely, effective delivery of results, with subsequent on and cross-selling. Typical engagements involve supporting client executives with setting their overall organizational (transformation) strategy, leadership talent assessments, enhancing companywide labor planning processes and tools, union negotiation support, organizational design, change management, companywide incentive plans, detailed headcount and cost analysis, market trend research and benchmarking, and uncovering improvement initiatives while outlining implementation requirements.

As a result of the acquisition by Accenture, the candidate will also be able to combine Accenture's tools and capabilities into Seabury Consulting’s offerings to address the digital transformation of the employee experience and services that will play a significant role in the workforce of the future.

The Senior Manager is responsible for gaining a comprehensive understanding of client business needs and priorities, is required to effectively steer the analysis and diagnose problems and to provide clear advice and recommendations to help clients make sound business decisions and become the trusted advisor of both existing and new client accounts. During and between engagements, a strong entrepreneurial mindset and professional experience will be applied to continuously pursue new offering opportunities for Seabury Consulting’s Human Capital practice, the sourcing of new engagements, and internal business development efforts.

Fundamental to the role is the ability to lead and mentor team members as they progress in their career. This involves the ability to outline requirements for completing analysis, acting as the lead client contact, and mentoring junior team members on core consulting skills. Additionally, our team looks to continuously improve our offerings by challenging how we approach engagements and refining the tools we use, especially in light of the acquisition by Accenture. An effective Senior Manager will recognize where opportunities lie for the group’s continuous improvement and take the lead on further developing these.

The ideal candidate will sit at the intersection of consulting and travel industry experience. They will have led high impact engagements for leading consultancies, while also having acquired deep industry experience working within the travel industry at an airline a strong plus.

The successful candidate will have:
• A strong ability to communicate with all levels within an organization, both written and verbally
• A curiosity/affinity to structure and steer work around numbers and data models
• Entrepreneurial and strategic mindset to discover internal and external opportunities
• Ability to quickly identify and define client needs and how those translate into our offerings
• Understanding of or interest in working in a complex international business environment
• Ability to work well under pressure to meet deadlines while still delivering a flawless product
• Be the trusted advisor and influencer for our client’s C-suite
• Passion for mentoring team members

Through entrepreneurship, we offer the ability to further shape the Human Capital practice within Accenture’s fast-growing Travel industry. Formal (leadership) training supported by a global Accenture network with training centers in Europe and North America is provided. As performance and experience develop, there are opportunities to take on additional leadership responsibilities in a meritocratic environment.

The Human Capital group is a close-knit team committed to having fun while delivering high impact results for our clients. At Seabury Consulting, you will be part of a dynamic team, comprised of high-powered and talented individuals, who have a blend of airline industry and top-tier strategy consulting experience, with compensation that is competitive with leading strategy consulting firms.

As part of Accenture, you will have benefit of working for a global company with offices in more than 200 cities worldwide, giving you the opportunity to grow and collaborate with teams across the world.
• *This position requires heavy travel (up to 100%) both domestically and internationally, often on short notice and for extended periods.

Basic Qualifications
• Minimum 6 years of strategy consulting experience including airline industry engagements
• Minimum 2 years leadership experience managing teams
• Bachelor’s degree required

Preferred Qualifications
• Must have held a mid-level or above leadership role; with a track record of successfully leading a team
• Experience managing complex projects in a fast-paced environment
• Innate interest in leading and mentoring team members and ensuring success for the client also aligns with skill and career development of the team
• Experience in and affinity for developing and maintaining client relationships, especially at the mid to senior level
• Demonstrated track record in thought leadership

Professional Skill Requirements
• Fluency in English (additional languages are considered a plus)
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and ability to articulate modelling requirements and logic (advanced proficiency considered a strong plus)
• Exceptional analytical, quantitative and conceptual skills, including Excel modeling
• Ability to work well under pressure to meet deadlines while delivering a flawless product
• Structured problem solving
• Proactive approach to tackling challenges (including through close collaboration with team members)
• Strong interpersonal skills

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

Equal Employment Opportunity

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration

jobs.title: Data Scientist Consultant, Manager
jobs.description:
Data Scientist Consultant, Manager

About Us...

Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating, and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build, and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 195 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at?www.cognizant.com.

Cognizant Consulting

Within Cognizant is Cognizant Consulting, a global consulting organization delivering strategic and domain consulting through industry and technology expertise. With over 6,000 consultants worldwide, Cognizant offers high-value consulting services that improve business performance and operational productivity, lower operational expenses and enhance overall performance. Clients draw upon our deep industry expertise, program and change management capabilities, and analytical objectivity to help improve business productivity, drive technology-enabled business transformation and increase shareholder value.??We provide a number of Business/IT Consulting Services including Business Strategy, IT Strategy & Roadmap Development, Process Re-Engineering & Transformation, Enterprise Architecture & Technology Selection, and Domain Solutions. The Cognizant Consulting team is a high performing organization that is continually expanding our client base and increasingly being recommended by analysts such as Forrester and Gartner. And we’re growing!

The Role:

Cognizant is changing the game in Data, DevOps, Cloud and Container based consultancy services. We enable enterprise organizations to capture value from their data, streamline their processes, reduce costs and increase efficiencies. We deploy teams to client sites (or remote through video conference) to help change mentalities and approaches by facilitating a DataOps culture through upskilling and pair programming.

We've built an outstanding team of technologists and are an advocate for challenging intelligent and hardworking individuals, like you! We are a team of fun, dedicated and professional people with a keen eye for innovation, curiosity and a love of data and technology.

We’re looking for?a Data Scientist Consultant?who can deliver within Cognizant’s Five Pillars of Consulting Excellence:?1)?Project Execution,?2)?Expertise,?3)?Business Development,?4)?Practice Development, and?5)?People Development. As a Consultant, this means partnering with clients and project stakeholders, colleagues creating high-quality client deliverables and taking ownership of producing client content and meeting client expectations; developing an expertise in your functional area, including obtaining certifications; contributing to Client Satisfaction and/or RFPs; supporting leadership and contributing to content development for service offerings; and participating in PeopleCare initiatives and exhibiting personal leadership at all times. In addition to enabling consulting excellence through the Five Pillars of Consulting, the specific requirements for this position are below.

Our solutions are in demand and we’re passionate about making a difference. If you have experience with the above, are a selfless leader, and are committed to client-facing environment; if you want to grow your career with a team that wants to build something great together, we want to hear from you! Apply now!

Responsibilities:
• Be the Data Scientist Consultant on a Generative AI Semantic Search for Cognizant clients. This will include ensuring the project is aligned with client requirements, delivering the project on time and on budget while working with multiple client and Cognizant stakeholders.
• Build and maintain pipelines and ensuring data quality for machine learning tasks.
• Apply statistical analysis and visualization techniques to various data, providing actionable insights to the business.
• Use advanced machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to deliver semantic search capabilities including pre-seeding and hyperparameter tuning of Generative AI models.
• Develop, implement, and enhance machine learning algorithms and models to solve complex challenges.
• Communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
• Stay up to date with the latest technology trends, apply new and emerging Gen AI and semantic search technologies.
• Be part of the leadership of a cross-functional technical team promoting a culture of collaboration and innovation.

Requirements:
• Master’s degree or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
• Minimum 3 years' experience in a similar role with a proven track record of leveraging data science to drive significant business impact.
• Strong knowledge and experience in NLP, machine learning, and semantic search.
• Extensive experience with machine learning algorithms, deep learning models, and AI.
• Proficiency in Python, R or similar languages, and experience with data science and machine learning libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn etc.
• Familiarity with data management tools (e.g. SQL, Hadoop, etc.) and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI etc.)
• Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and present insights to stakeholders.
• Ability to think strategically, work independently, handle multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.
• Strong analytical, problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Preferred:
• Experience with AGI or related technologies.
• Experience with Semantic Web technologies (RDF, OWL, SPARQL).

Work Authorization

Cognizant will only consider applicants for this position who are legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship (H-1B, L-1B, L-1A, etc.)

Salary and Other Compensation

The annual salary for this position is between?$109,030 - $160,610 depending on experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate.

This position is also eligible for Cognizant’s discretionary annual incentive program and stock awards, based on performance and subject to the terms of Cognizant’s applicable plans.

Benefits

Cognizant offers the following benefits?for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:

· Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance

· Paid holidays plus Paid Time Off

· 401(k) plan and contributions

· Long-term/Short-term Disability

· Paid Parental Leave

· Employee Stock Purchase Plan

Disclaimer:?The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. Cognizant reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law

jobs.title: Senior Consultant, Brand Strategy
jobs.description:
As a Brand Strategy team member, you will apply strategic, analytical, and creative thinking to solve challenging brand issues for clients on a daily basis. You will consult across industries, throughout the world, and on a range of brand topics (e.g., positioning, brand architecture, naming, customer experience and signature cues).

As a Senior Consultant, you will be responsible for... understanding client situations, gathering and synthesizing information (e.g., industry, company, competition), and making preliminary recommendations to your case team. You will contribute substantially to case delivery in terms of thinking and project management. You will develop strategic concepts, collect evidence, and create a well-designed process and solution, while working collaboratively with the broader case-team. This is an opportunity to join a talented and passionate group in developing and building some of the world’s leading brands. The team-oriented environment allows for exposure to Senior Partners across the business and the opportunity to be involved in key decision-making.

In your day to day, you will:

Research and Build Ideas
• Gather, organize and summarize information on client business strategy, industry dynamics, best practices, communications audits, and customer insights to identify key implications
• Conduct in-depth interviews with client management and key stakeholders
• Support case team planning and analysis of quantitative and qualitative customer / prospect research, from discrete choice analysis to focus groups
• Use findings and insights to create compelling content and stories​

Be Creative​ and Collaborative
• Quickly pick up skills and knowledge in new areas, leveraging client, firm, and external resources
• Collaborate with other consultants and designers to explore alternatives and develop thinking (e.g., brainstorming sessions)
• Contribute to the development and storyline of client presentations
• Effectively communicate with, and present to internal case teams and external client teams
• Consistently develop creative concepts using Lippincott frameworks and methodologies to solve problems​
• Use creative thinking and innovative problem-solving skills and relate work to client needs​
• Support new business efforts by participating in the development of content in proposals​

Who You Are:

Knowledgeable
• At least 3 years in strategy consulting, corporate strategy, brand strategy, brand management, innovation, or strategic planning
• Ability to think creatively while building on and relating work to past experience
• Outstanding presentation, writing, and interpersonal skills, and the ability to communicate effectively at all levels of both internal and client organizations
• Bachelor’s degree in relevant field required; MBA or equivalent welcomed, but not necessary

Passionate and Driven
• A passion for problem solving, creative expression, and improving the way companies relate to customers
• A detailed, methodical, and rigorous approach to finding solutions and a flexibility in applying them
• A willingness to push your thinking, attack issues from multiple angles and stretch yourself to provide outstanding brand ideas to clients
• An appetite for learning and wrestling with challenging topics across a diverse range of clients/ industries
• Hold yourself and your work to a very high standard, pushing ideas further to challenge yourself, your colleagues, and our clients’ ways of thinking
• Constructively participate as part of a project team, bringing optimism and a collaborative spirit to build on and nurture ideas
• Desire to proactively seek constructive feedback and input to develop your knowledge, skills, and thinking

About Lippincott

Lippincott is a creative consultancy specializing in brand and innovation. We have a passion for solving our clients’ toughest challenges with a proven combination of strategic rigor and design excellence. A pioneer since 1943, we have shaped some of the world’s most iconic brands and experiences.

Who We Are, Together…

We embody key values that drive our culture. We demand better, reach higher, and expect more of ourselves and our colleagues. We demonstrate gratitude, offer support, and embrace optimism every day. We celebrate debate, discussion, disagreement, and feedback, with an open mind to new ways of thinking and doing. We act with passion, intention, and goodwill while building on and elevating everyone’s contributions and sharing in our collective success.

In our pursuit to make it meaningful, we want our people to feel heard, respected and valued through our words and actions – goals we can only achieve with a sustained commitment to inclusion, diversity and belonging. We seek the best and brightest ideas from a diverse representation of backgrounds and experiences because we know that’s what it takes to continuously push the boundaries, solve our clients’ most complex challenges, and foster an inspiring culture of rigorous creativity. We celebrate and leverage our differences and our commonalities so everyone feels safe, supported and encouraged to be wide open, to say “yes, and!” and to demand better of ourselves and one another. We aspire to be positive role models for inclusion at an individual level, corporate level, and societal level.

Lippincott is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All employment decisions at Lippincott are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications without regard to race, national origin, age, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran or disability status or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in locations where we operate. We are committed to promoting a workplace of which we can all be proud.

The applicable base pay for this role ranges from $90,000 - $105,000. The base pay offered will be determined on factors such as experience, skills, training, location, certifications, and education. Decisions will be determined on a case-by-case basis. In addition to the base salary, this position will be eligible for performance-based incentives.

We are excited to offer a competitive total rewards package which includes health benefits, 401K savings as well as employee assistance programs.

#Lippincott

jobs.title: Agriculture
jobs.description:
S&P Global Commodity Insights

The Role : Consultant Agriculture (Biofuels & Biofeedstocks...

Grade / Level (relevant for internal applicants only) : 10

The Location : Gurgaon, India

The Team : You will be part of the global agribusiness consulting team that works on market, economic and due diligence agricultural and bioenergy projects for both commercial and public sector clients.

This diverse team works collaboratively with other consulting teams within the wider S&P Global Commodity Insights team, in areas such as energy, chemicals, macroeconomics, maritime and mobility.

The Impact : Working in the agriculture, bio-feedstocks and biofuels markets, you will be at the forefront of our agriculture, decarbonization and energy transition research and analysis, helping clients deliver agriculturally based solutions and new sources of clean energy supplies, and supporting our company-wide effort to develop new intellectual property in this area.

This is a rapidly evolving and dynamic sector and the work connected with this position will both help develop the commercial use of new sources of energy while at the same time deliver lower carbon intensity solutions for the economy.

What’s in it for you : In this position you will have full access to data, insights and research that will give you a unique opportunity for personal growth in an area of critical need to companies, governments and NGOs.

It is our expectation that you will :
• work with key industry thought leaders and researchers in the agriculture and energy transition area from initial commercial development to market expansion
• be exposed to major companies and institutions in the agriculture and energy transition area
• be part of and work within a diverse team of researchers and consultants globally

Responsibilities : You will be a key member of the S&P Global Commodity Insights (Agribusiness) Consulting team. You will play a significant role in all areas of our agribusiness consulting, as well as having the opportunity to work and develop specific areas of interest.

Key responsibilities will include :
• developing and applying your agricultural market and economic analytical skills to client projects
• working on a range of assignments, including very large highly complex projects as well as smaller scale initiatives
• working as part of a team of consultants as well as independently on project execution and delivery
• working across geographies within agribusiness consulting as well as other consulting groups within S&P Global Commodity Insights
• being flexible in working on projects in other areas of agribusiness
• At least three years relevant experience in the agribusiness and / or bioenergy sector, traditionally acquired by working for industry, consulting, technology firms and / or government.
• Post-graduate degree (likely to be in agriculture, bioenergy, business or economics)
• Solid economic and analytical research skills and the ability to work independently
• Highly organized and creative skills, with accomplished time and project management
• Highly effective verbal and written communication skills in the English language; good interpersonal skills
• Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment and to navigate and excel in a complex, multi-disciplinary global organization

Flexible Working (optional)

We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and / or an element of remote working are usually possible.

Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can.

Return to Work

Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative (link to career site page when available), we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.

About Company Statement :

S&P Global delivers essential intelligence that powers decision making. We provide the world’s leading organizations with the right data, connected technologies and expertise they need to move ahead.

As part of our team, you’ll help solve complex challenges that equip businesses, governments and individuals with the knowledge to adapt to a changing economic landscape.

S&P Global Commodity Insights enables organizations to create long-term, sustainable value with data and insights for a complete view on the global energy and commodities markets.

Last updated : 2023-11-16

jobs.title: Site Manager
jobs.description:
Hagerty Consulting, Inc. (Hagerty) is the nation's leading emergency management and homeland security consulting firm. Known for its public spirit, innovative thinking, problem-solving, and exceptional people, Hagerty is sought after to work on some of the largest and most complex crisis and emergency management issues. We serve our clients across the nation to enhance their preparedness... programs; create more resilient and sustainable communities; provide innovative solutions to enhance their response; and obtain and manage grants and loans to support their recovery.

Hagerty is currently supporting a humanitarian mission that provides emergency sheltering and other services to vulnerable populations in New York City. This is a high-tempo, client-facing operation that requires individuals who can engage in complex, sensitive, and fast-moving conversations and rapidly provide thoughtful analysis of problems, risks, and inefficiencies and solutions and recommendations to address them. The role requires individuals with a high level of professionalism, humility, interpersonal skills, and precision with communications.

We are looking for Site Managers to join our New York City project and are prioritizing mid to senior-level candidates with a background in emergency management, humanitarian relief, and management consulting. . This is a contract position that will be on-site in New York City. The ideal candidate should have a passion for emergency management, be a self-starter, and have the desire to solve complex problems for our clients.

Candidates for this position should have experience managing emergency response or humanitarian relief operations and logistics. Successful candidates will be able to work collaboratively with stakeholders from different departments and agencies, troubleshooting issues and solving problems as they arise, and provide daily site reporting and communications back to agency leadership.

Candidates for the role of Site Manager must possess the following qualifications:
• A bachelor's degree or higher.
• At least seven (7) years of professional experience in emergency management, humanitarian or migrant support coordination, or a related field.
• The ability to coordinate across partner agencies to ensure a fully functioning site and solve problems that arise during the operation of the site.
• Experience troubleshooting and escalating issues to leadership as needed.
• Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite products (including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Teams, and SharePoint).
• Strong organizational and analytical capabilities and strong attention to detail.
• The ability to provide summary products, meeting recaps, or deliverables for clients.
• A willingness to be on-site working with a client for more than one month.
• The ability to work 12-hour nights and weekend shifts as needed based on the client's operational tempo.
• The ability to remain calm and poised under pressure, work successfully on multiple priorities simultaneously, and remain focused when working under tight deadlines.

Candidates for the role of Site Manager may also have the following qualifications:
• A background working with and supporting vulnerable populations.
• Experience working as part of an Operations or Logistics Section on a previous disaster.
• Experience managing site operations during the COVID-19 pandemic or managing a similar operation during a disaster event.

Salary: The salary range is $95,000-$155,000. Compensation decisions depend on a wide range of factors, including but not limited to skills, experience and training, licensure and certifications, location, travel requirements, and other business and organizational needs.

Equal Opportunity Employer Veterans/Disabled

jobs.title: EPM OneStream Consultant, Manager
jobs.description:
A career in our Enterprise Performance Management practice, within Finance Consulting services, will provide the opportunity to work alongside CEOs, CFOs, controllers and treasurers to optimise the structure of their finance functions and improve their contribution to the business. We support our clients by addressing the challenges of achieving appropriate standards of control, efficient back... office opportunities and support to the business through insight and challenge. Our team helps clients optimise and align financial planning, consolidation, reporting and analytics processes, systems and information to provide business insights that drive better decisions and actions.

To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.

As a Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:
• Develop new skills outside of comfort zone.
• Act to resolve issues which prevent the team working effectively.
• Coach others, recognise their strengths, and encourage them to take ownership of their personal development.
• Analyse complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations.
• Use multiple sources of information including broader stakeholder views to develop solutions and recommendations.
• Address sub-standard work or work that does not meet firm's/client's expectations.
• Use data and insights to inform conclusions and support decision-making.
• Develop a point of view on key global trends, and how they impact clients.
• Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties.
• Simplify complex messages, highlighting and summarising key points.
• Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.

Job Requirements and Preferences:

Basic Qualifications:

Minimum Degree Required:
Bachelor Degree

Required Fields of Study:
Accounting, Computer and Information Science, Finance, Information Technology

Minimum Years of Experience:
5 year(s)

Preferred Qualifications:

OneStream Certified Associate Administration Certification

OneStream Certified Professional (OCP) -Lead Architect

Degree Preferred:
Master of Business Administration

Preferred Knowledge/Skills:

Demonstrates intimate-level abilities and/or a proven record of success in the following:
• Working in a professional services environment (a combination of industry, management consulting and/or software implementation);
• Managing and executing large finance, enterprise and/or data architecture transformation programs;
• Leading the design, build, migration, and testing of OneStream for multi-dimensional data models (dimensions, hierarchies, attributes); input template and report build; Data Integration and Extract Transform and Load (ETL) concepts; understanding of calcs (allocation, top-down spreading, currencies); and, workflow, data permissions and security;
• Leading the configuration of OneStream including but not limited to : Workflows, Data Sources, Transformation Rules, Business Rules and Calculations, Dashboards, Data Management Sequences, Cube / Master Data, System Security;
• Leading core Accounting areas including Performance Management (executive dashboards management reporting, planning, budgeting & forecasting, analytics & decision support); Record-to-Report (financial close, consolidation, financial reporting, Fixed Assets, Inventory, Payroll); Order-to-Cash (order entry, customer credit, invoicing, accounts receivable, collections); and, Procure-to-Pay (procurement, accounts payable, invoicing);
• Managing process improvement or re-engineering initiatives and projects in the core back office accounting and/or FP&A areas as either a consultant or internal role;
• Possessing a client service orientation such as building solid relationships with clients; approaching clients in an organized manner, demonstrating flexibility in prioritizing and completing tasks; and,
• Working in an Agile project management environment for tool implementation projects.

Demonstrates intimate-level abilities and/or a proven record of success managing consulting engagements pertaining to:
• Designing operational metrics to support strategic plans, dashboard design and benchmarking/standard industry practices;
• Understanding common issues facing clients in their industry;
• Identifying and addressing client needs: building, maintaining, and utilizing networks of client relationships and community involvement; communicating value propositions; managing resource requirements, project workflow, budgets, billing and collections, and preparing and/or coordinating complex written and verbal materials;
• Managing teams to create an atmosphere of trust; seeking diverse views to encourage improvement and innovation; and coaching staff including providing timely meaningful written and verbal feedback;
• Leveraging business intelligence tools to support the reporting and monitoring of performance metrics; and,
• Automating performance metrics using technologies such as Access, SharePoint and the Program Assessment Rating Tool.

Learn more about how we work: https://pwc.to/how-we-work

PwC does not intend to hire experienced or entry level job seekers who will need, now or in the future, PwC sponsorship through the H-1B lottery, except as set forth within the following policy: https://pwc.to/H-1B-Lottery-Policy.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at PwC without regard to race; creed; color; religion; national origin; sex; age; disability; sexual orientation; gender identity or expression; genetic predisposition or carrier status; veteran, marital, or citizenship status; or any other status protected by law. PwC is proud to be an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer.

For positions based in San Francisco, consideration of qualified candidates with arrest and conviction records will be in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

For positions in California, Colorado, Hawaii, Nevada, New York State, or Washington State, or for opportunities that will report to a supervisor, office or other work site in New York State, please visit the following link for pay range information: https://pwc.to/payrange-v1-advisorymanager

jobs.title: Consultant II, Life Sciences | Health Solutions
jobs.description:
About the Role

We provide innovative solutions that optimize performance in the short term and prepare for future strategic, operational, financial and legal challenges unique to our healthcare and life sciences clients...

What You'll Do
• Perform the day-to-day activities of projects including interaction with client personnel and FTI team members.
• Work with relational database programs (e.g., Microsoft SQL Server, Access, etc.), FTI tools and templates to assess and quantify the areas of healthcare industry and/or analytic focus.
• Apply qualitative and quantitative skills to various engagements.
• Articulate our findings to counsel/client and to assist in strategic planning of ongoing engagements.
• Maintain detailed work paper records of assumptions, methodologies, and information sources employed during the performance of all analytical tasks.
• Deliver a quality work product within established timeframes.

How You'll Grow

Our experienced professionals at the Consultant level work primarily with senior leadership in FTI offices, analyzing and leveraging operational and financial data to solve complex business issues for our clients. Consultants are generally responsible for the day-to-day activities of a project. These professionals will be interacting with the Senior Managing Directors and Managing Directors in identifying the project goals, providing guidance to a project team, and preparing deliverables. Experienced professionals will be responsible for the quality control on the projects and ensuring that the project goals are met. Experienced professionals will facilitate the projects with the use of proprietary data and complex modeling. They will develop presentations and dashboards for the clients, participate in client conference calls and manage the project as it moves towards various milestones.

Basic Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree or higher.
• Minimum of 1 year of experience working in professional services consulting (e.g. litigation and/or disputes consulting, operational and/or compliance consulting).
• Must be willing to travel, travel requirements can be up to 50% based on client demands.
• Experience with relational database programs (e.g., Microsoft SQL Server, Access, etc.).

#LI-TD1

Our Benefits

Apart from the well-structured career path and excellent team environment, our employees enjoy a variety of perks and benefits. Our benefits include, but are not limited to:
• Competitive salary and bonus plans
• Generous paid holidays, time off and parental leave
• Full package of benefits plans
• Company matched 401K
• Annual paid volunteer hours
• Corporate matching for charitable donations
• Potential for flexible working arrangements
• Free snacks and drinks

About FTI Consulting

What makes us unique? With more than 5,000 employees located in offices in every corner of the globe, we are the firm our clients call when their most important issues are at stake. Regardless of what level you are, you will have the opportunity to work alongside and learn from top experts in your field on high-profile engagements that impact history. Our culture is collaborative, and we value diversity, recognition, development and making a difference in our communities.

FTI Consulting is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange and has been recognized as a Best Firm to Work For by Consulting magazine and one of America's Best Management Consulting Firms by Forbes . jobs.title: Senior Solutions Consultant
jobs.description:
Our success is reliant on building teams that include people from different backgrounds and experiences who can elevate assumptions and ideas with fresh perspectives. We're dedicated to hiring the whole human, not just a resume. To that end, we look for a diverse pool of applicants-including those from historically marginalized groups. We would like to invite you to apply even if you don't think... you meet all of the requirements listed below. We don't want a few lines in a job description to get between us and the opportunity to meet you.

About The Team

This role will report into our Solutions Consulting team. The Solutions Consulting team is an integral part of the Outreach Go-To-Market function. We focus on driving real business impact for prospects by being both technology and domain experts. We are expected to understand our prospect’s challenges and objectives - then guide them toward lasting solutions. We do this by partnering with other functions, internally (professional services, product, engineering, success, marketing) and externally (partners).

The Role

Responsibilities

Working in a fast-growth company means that no day is ever the same! Here are the main responsibilities and tasks you’ll undertake while working with us:

Your Daily Adventures Will Include
• Becoming and acting as a subject matter expert on the Outreach platform and acting as a trusted advisor to both customers and internal teams
• Partner and collaborate with Sales to identify customer and prospect selling tools, business processes, opportunities and risks through in-depth discovery
• Helping qualify opportunities through in-depth discovery of customer and prospect business processes in order identify opportunities and risks that need to be addressed during the sales process
• Participate in product demonstrations highlighting Outreach's business value
• Understanding goals and value propositions for various stakeholders within customer organizations
• Ensuring effective communication of customer and prospect pains and requirements to Outreach’s onboarding and implementation teams
• Building industry credibility through continuous learning of new sales trends & technology from blogs, podcasts, and other industry publications
• Collaborating with Product, Customer Success, and other Outreach teams to build a better company and platform for our customers
• Sharing your product and selling knowledge with other Outreach teams, helping them strengthen their own skills, and better support our customers and prospects

Our Vision of You
• Experience – You have 4+ years of experience in pre-sales/solutions consulting
• Inquisitive Problem Solver – You ask thoughtful questions resulting in meaningful insights; you probe in a way that leads people to step outside their mindset; you unearth pain points and elicit new ideas
• Problem Solver – You are able to translate customer use cases and business goals into scalable, and value-based solutions
• Excellent Presentation Skills – You can deliver engaging demonstrations, drawing on customer examples and industry insights to highlight business value for a diverse range of stakeholders personas

Why You’ll Love It Here
• Generous medical, dental, and vision coverage for full-time employees and their dependents
• Flexible time off
• 401k to help you save for the future
• Company-organized and personal paid volunteer days to support the community that supports us
• Fun company and team outings (or virtual events these days!) because we play just as hard as we work
• Diversity and inclusion programs that promote employee resource groups like OWN (Outreach Women's Network), AAPI, Rainbow (LGBTQIA+), Gender+, LatinX, Black Excellence, Disability Community, and Veterans
• A parental leave program that includes not just extended time off but options for a paid night nurse, gradual return to work, and the Gottman Institute's Bringing Home Baby course for new parents
• Employee referral bonuses to encourage the addition of great new people to the team
• Plus, unlimited snacks and beverages in our kitchen
• We’re an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status

jobs.description:
Senior Technology & Systems Consultant

Are you a technology guru with a positive attitude and good communication skills? Then you'll fit right in at iCorps Technologies...

iCorps Technologies, a leading IT Consulting, Managed Services and Cloud Computing Company, providing strategic leadership, innovative services and hands-on expertise to businesses. iCorps is ranked as one of the largest IT consulting companies in Massachusetts by the Boston Business Journal. We are a Microsoft Gold Partner and consistently make CRN's national list of top Tech Elite Solution Providers and Managed Services Providers. An industry pioneer, the iCorps team guides some of the fastest-growing organizations and collaborates with hundreds of clients to help transform their businesses - while delivering exceptional results. We pride ourselves in hiring only the best and the brightest. If you are a super star go-getter with a proven track record of success and looking for a new challenge-give us a call!

And because we value the hard work of our employees, iCorps offers its consultants competitive pay and benefits including 20 days of PTO for seniors, sick days, a quarterly bonus potential, and 401K, your birthday as a holiday, Triple AAA membership and more!

iCorps hires only the best and the brightest. If that's you, then it's time for you to join our team.

Job Description:

Working in NYC and the 5 boroughs, Senior consultants' responsibilities include: Managing all aspects of customer's technologies; Mentoring, educating, guiding and supporting associate/mid-level team members; Project management: IT assessments, recommendations and proposals; and nurturing customer relationships. Senior's play a crucial role at iCorps as they serve as the junction point between client service delivery excellence, and the professional development of our consultants. This is a hands on technology role.

Responsibilities:
• Provide clients with technical expertise pertaining to networking, mobility, virtualization and cloud-based solutions
• Evaluate, recommend, and execute new technologies and update existing infrastructure to ensure optimal network performance
• Develop IT strategies to ensure the networking, compute and storage infrastructure meets existing and future requirements based on needs and regulations
• Have an understanding of hybrid cloud architectures and proven best practices that enable high operational resiliency
• Candidate must have the ability to work in a variety of environments, have excellent follow-up skills, provide detailed documentation, and be able to work effectively and independently
• Participation in proposal content, product research, and sales meetings with prospective clients may be required

Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
• Certifications strongly preferred: MCITP, CCNA, CISSP, and VC
• Minimum of 5 plus years' experience with the maintaining, troubleshooting, and supporting of various technology environments
• Prior consulting experience is highly desirable
• Comprehensive understanding of operating platforms, connectivity, security, and information management
• Deep knowledge of Microsoft Exchange (Office 365, EMS, Azure and Systems Center a +), Active Directory, and DNS
• Must be strong in all aspects of Microsoft back office platforms
• Strong hands-on networking, firewalls, routing and switching experience
• Experience with virtualization technologies, such as VMware, Citrix and Microsoft
• Outstanding and proven communication at all levels within an organization, project management, and organizational skills required

Salary Range:

Depending on level of experience, between $110k-$160k a year.

We Offer:

Great compensation and benefits, salary range is between 110-160k a year as well as the opportunity to join a strong and stable organization.

For more information, please visit our website at www.icorps.com or send your resume to hr@icorps.com.
